original: Bengtsson, Johan Thorsten Israel, bankdirektör, Göteborg, f. 24/10/93 i Reftele, Jönköp. 1., av agronom Anders B. o. Helène Samuelsson. G. 21 m. Asta Lundgren. Barn: Bertil f. 26. — Stud:ex. 11, jur. kand. 16, fil. kand. 18. Res. t. Engl. 24-25, USA 32 o. 33. Omb :man o. avd :chef i För-isäkr. A-’B Nornan 18, v. dir. 23, omb :-man o. chef f. finansavd. i Brand- o. Livförsäkr. A-B Svea 29, v. dir. 32, v. verkst. dir. i A-B Gbgs Bank 34, verkst. dir. o. chef f. banken 39. Led. av styr. f. Sv. bankfören., Försäkr. A-B Nornan, Gbgs Inteckn:- o. Garanti A-B, Sv. Obligationskredit A-B, A-B Lånekassan av 1914, ordf. i styr. f. fören. De fatt. vänner. Skr.: div. upps. i ekon. ämnen i Statsvet :’skapl. Tidskr., Nord. Försäkr :tidskr. m. fi. RNO, RVO, Försäkr. A-B Nornans förtj:M.
translated: Bengtsson, Johan Thorsten Israel, bank director, Gothenburg, b. 24/10/93 in Reftele, Jönköping County, 1st child of agronomist Anders B. and Helène Samuelsson. Married in 1921 to Asta Lundgren. Children: Bertil b. 1926. Education: high school diploma 1911, law degree 1916, Bachelor of Philosophy 1918. Traveled to England from 1924-1925 and to the USA in 1932 and 1933. Was a trustee and department head at the insurance company Försäkr. A-B Nornan in 1918, vice director in 1923, trustee and head of the finance department in the insurance company Brand- and Livförsäkr. A-B Svea in 1929, vice director in 1932, and deputy managing director at A-B Gbgs Bank in 1934 and managing director and head of the bank in 1939. Was a member of the board of directors for the Swedish Bank Association, Försäkr. A-B Nornan, Gbgs Inteckn- and Garanti A-B, Swedish Obligation Credit A-B, and A-B Lånekassan av 1914. Chairman of the board of directors for the association De fatt. vänner. Wrote various articles in economics for Statsvet:skapl. Tidskr., Nord. Försäkr:tidskr. and others. Awarded RNO, RVO, and Försäkr A-B Nornan's merit medal.

structured.name: Johan Thorsten Israel Bengtsson
structured.description: Johan Thorsten Israel Bengtsson (1893-10-24) was a bank director from Gothenburg, Sweden. He was born in Reftele, Jönköping County as the eldest child of agronomist Anders B. Bengtsson and Helène Samuelsson. He married Asta Lundgren in 1921 and they had a son named Bertil in 1926. Bengtsson had a high school diploma (1911), a law degree (1916), and a Bachelor of Philosophy (1918). He traveled to England in 1924-1925 and to the USA in 1932 and 1933. He worked at Försäkr. A-B Nornan from 1918-1929, Brand- and Livförsäkr. A-B Svea from 1929-1932, and A-B Gbgs Bank from 1934-1939. He served as a trustee, vice director, deputy managing director, and managing director in various organizations and was the chairman of the board of directors for the association De fatt. vänner. Bengtsson wrote several articles in economics for Statsvet:skapl. Tidskr., Nord. Försäkr:tidskr., and others.
